Package suga.engine

Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
suga.engine.GameEngine
public class GameEngine extends Object
A collection of static methods that are used to make starting, closing and managing a game easier.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    GameEngine.Window
    An enum of pre-defined resolutions to open a game window at.

    • getLogger

      public static Logger getLogger()
      Accessor method for the logger being used by the GameEngine.
      Returns:
      The logger currently in use by the GameEngine.

    • setLogger

      public static void setLogger(Logger logger)
      Setter method for the logger being used by the GameEngine.
      Parameters:
      logger - The new logger for the GameEngine to use.

    • stop

      public static void stop()
      Closes both the logic and graphics thread.

    • launchGameWindow

      public static void launchGameWindow(int width, int height, String name, boolean border, GraphicsPanel panel, Color background, int logicRate, int frameRate, GameKeyListener keyListener, GameMouseListener mouseListener, Game game)
      Creates a new game window with all the possible configuration options being specified.
      Parameters:
      width - The width to create the game window at.
      height - The height to create the game window at.
      name - The name for the resulting window.
      border - Whether to hide the border or not when creating the window.
      panel - The graphics panel to be used for this game.
      background - The background color for the panel.
      logicRate - How many times per second the game logic should be called.
      frameRate - How many frames per second should the graphics thread target.
      keyListener - The key listener to be used for this new window. Will override active frame.
      mouseListener - The mouse listener to use for this window. Will override active frame.
      game - The game to attach to this window. Will override currently active panel or input listeners.
